document_title: Intestinal infections: Symptoms, causes and prevention
subsection_content:
Intestinal infections rarely cause complications in healthy adults and usually go away in less than a week. However, young children and the elderly are often more susceptible to the disease due to their weak immune systems, and are at risk of facing many serious complications if not treated early. Specifically includes:
High fever.; Muscle pain; Inability to control bowel movements; CKD.; Intestinal bleeding.; Anemia.
subsection_title: nhiem trung duong ruot.json. Complications of intestinal infection
